text: I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Your best life will not be found in comfort. It will be found in fighting for what you believe in.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Every adversity, every failure, every heartbreak, carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: We have to live life with a sense of urgency so not a minute is wasted.
author: Les Brown

text: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The greater the impact you want to make, the greater your influence needs to be.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: The first rule of business; treat others like they want to treat you.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Elegance does not consist in putting on a new dress.
author: Coco Chanel

text: The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Human beings believe just as they breathe - in order to survive.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
author: Colin Powell

text: Nothing we see or hear is perfect. But right there in the imperfection is perfect reality.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: If you don't make things happen then things will happen to you.
author: Robert Collier

text: Science can flourish only in an atmosphere of free speech.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
author: Henry Ford

text: Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often.
author: Mae West

text: Whereever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: All problems are illusions of the mind.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: If you believe you can, you can. If you believe you can't, then, well you can't.
author: Celestine Chua

text: I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.
author: Mae West

text: A golden cage is still just a cage.
author: Anita Krizzan

text: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
author: Herman Melville

text: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: If you practiced for the day, then you have won. If you were lazy for the day, then you have lost.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.
author: Woody Allen

text: The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Time heals what reason cannot.
author: Seneca

text: Genius, in truth, means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
author: William James

text: Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Not how long, but how well you have lived is the main thing.
author: Seneca

text: The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: If you are not living each day with excitement, energy, and passion, then you are not living true to your life purpose.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Chase your passion, not your pension.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A moving door hinge never corrodes. Flowing water never grows stagnant.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
author: Buddha

text: Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

text: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Success is not the result of making money; making money is the result of success - and success is in direct proportion to our service.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: You may think I'm small, but I have a universe inside my mind.
author: Yoko Ono

text: By perseverance the snail reached the ark.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: Trust is built and maintained by many small actions over time.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.
author: John Wooden

text: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
author: Euripides

text: Forgive those who have hurt you.
author: Les Brown

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: Les Brown

text: Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self.
author: Ralph Marston

text: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
author: Og Mandino

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Never whine, never complain, never try to justify yourself.
author: Robert Greene

text: The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic.
author: Woody Allen

text: If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.
author: Buddha

text: If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.
author: Morgan Wootten

text: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
author: Yoko Ono

text: To himself everyone is immortal; he may know that he is going to die, but he can never know he is dead.
author: Samuel Butler

text: The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.
author: Charles Dickens

text: There is no value in anything until it is finished.
author: Genghis Khan

text: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: You don't have to move mountains. You'll change the world simply by being a warm, kind-hearted human being.
author: Anita Krizzan

text: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.
author: Gary Keller

text: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: If you can't imagine it, you can't have it.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Remember where you came from, where you're going, and why you created this mess you got yourself into in the first place.
author: Richard Bach

text: We are like islands in the sea, separate on the surface but connected in the deep.
author: William James

text: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: The essence of the Way is detachment.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Faith means believing the unbelievable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Big people don't make people feel small.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

text: Don't shortchange yourself when it comes to investing in your own better future.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The wise man reads both books and life itself.
author: Lin Yutang

text: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Always look on the bright side of things. If you can't comprehend this, polish that which has become dull until it begins to shine.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The trouble with most of us is that we'd rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: There is no self-discovery without pain and loss.
author: Anita Krizzan

text: A mountain never yields to the wind no matter how strong it is.
author: Zen Proverb

text: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
author: Euripides

text: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

text: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The whole problem with the world is the fools and fanatics are always so sure of themselves, and wiser people are full of doubts.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.
author: Mark Twain

text: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Life is not meant to be easy my child, but take courage: it can be delightful.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: When one door closes another door opens.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: You are the only problem you will ever have and you are the only solution.
author: Bob Proctor

text: The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.
author: Will Rogers

text: You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.
author: Robin Williams

text: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
author: John Wooden

text: Learning is a weightless treasure you can always carry easily.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: When you rise in the morning, form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
author: Sydney Smith

text: At first dreams seem impossible, then improbable, then inevitable.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
author: Seneca

text: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Few things are more deceptive than memories.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Would you rather learn to deal with the truth now than be forced to do so later on?
author: Celestine Chua

text: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: The whole world is a series of miracles, but we're so used to them we call them ordinary things.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Humans and prosperity never endure side by side for long.
author: Herodotus

text: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
author: Mae West

text: There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: Judge your success by what you had to give up in order to get it.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Write to help yourself, publish to help others.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Wrong turns are as important as right turns. More important, sometimes.
author: Richard Bach

text: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
author: James Allen

text: He who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it the second time.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dream.
author: Les Brown

text: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
author: Alfred Adler

text: To live outside the law, you must be honest.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: You have as much laughter as you have faith.
author: Martin Luther

text: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
author: Tony Robbins

text: If you look for perfection, you'll never be content.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: To be great is to be misunderstood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Your home is where your thoughts find peace.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own. Imagination is a force that can actually manifest a reality.
author: James Cameron

text: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
author: Les Brown

text: It is up to each of us to sing as we feel moved by the overall song of life.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Leave the beaten track behind occasionally and dive into the woods. Every time you do you will be certain to find something you have never seen before.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.
author: Isaac Newton

text: A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things.
author: Barack Obama

text: You change the world by being yourself.
author: Yoko Ono

text: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: To achieve, you need thought. You have to know what you are doing and that's real power.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Do not allow your inner doubts to keep you from achieving what you can do.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: As soon as you truly commit to making something happen, the ?how' will reveal itself.
author: Tony Robbins

text: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Never be bored, and you will never be boring.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Don't seek, don't avoid, don't expect. Take what comes and be happy.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
author: Criss Jami

text: The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.
author: Seungsahn

text: If you truly expect something to be difficult, it will be.
author: Peter A. Cohen

text: You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
author: Richard Bach

text: Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Real learning comes about when the competitive spirit has ceased.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
author: Bob Marley

text: Sorrow is how we learn to love.
author: Rita Mae Brown

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Zen Proverb

text: There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference.
author: William James

text: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Whatever happens always happens on time.
author: Zen Proverb

text: The big secret in life is that there is no big secret. Whatever your goal, you can get there if you're willing to work.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
author: Alexander Pope

text: The deeper the truth in a creative work, the longer it will live.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: What you seek is seeking you.
author: Rumi

text: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.
author: Judy Garland

text: Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.
author: Yoko Ono

text: Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.
author: James Allen

text: It's your life; you don't need someone's permission to live the life you want. Be brave to live from your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering.
author: Charles Dickens

text: You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.
author: Alexander Pope

text: Life must be rich and full of loving-it's no good otherwise, no good at all, for anyone.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: One of the really tough things is figuring out what questions to ask. Once you figure out the question, then the answer is relatively easy.
author: Elon Musk

text: Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.
author: Dogen

text: It isn't what you do, but how you do it.
author: John Wooden

text: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

text: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
author: Pema Chodron

text: No one has ever become poor by giving.
author: Anne Frank

text: A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
author: Estee Lauder

text: If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: To improve is to change, so to be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Stay away from people who makes you feel like you are wasting their time.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: We have a choice everyday regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day.
author: Charles Swindoll

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
author: Helen Keller

text: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
author: Og Mandino

text: From error to error one discovers the entire truth.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
author: James Matthew Barrie

text: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: We turn not older with years but newer every day.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

text: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.
author: Zhuangzi

text: My definition of success is control.
author: Kenneth Branagh

text: Judgments prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
author: Lao Tzu

text: People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: No matter how qualified or deserving we are, we will never reach a better life until we can imagine it for ourselves and allow ourselves to have it.
author: Richard Bach

text: Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: 20 percent of your activities will account for 80 percent of your results.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Things do not have meaning. We assign meaning to everything.
author: Tony Robbins

text: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
author: Franz Kafka

text: For things to change, you have to change.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Relax. Nothing is under control.
author: Adi Da Samraj

text: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Anyone who dreams of an uncommon life eventually discovers there is no choice but to seek an uncommon approach to living it.
author: Gary Keller

text: The goal of an artist is to create the definitive work that cannot be surpassed.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Faults are yours to fix, not to curse.
author: Colin Powell

text: Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: It is well known that those who do not trust themselves never trust others.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
author: Unknown

text: Trust in dreams, for in them is the hidden gate to eternity.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Common sense is not so common.
author: Voltaire

text: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.
author: James Allen

text: Constantly seek criticism. A well thought out critique of whatever you're doing is as valuable as gold.
author: Elon Musk

text: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Life is filled with secrets. You can't learn them all at once.
author: Dan Brown

text: Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit.
author: Les Brown

text: Allow motion to equal emotion.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: You have to make time, even for something as universal as staring at the stars.
author: W.P. Kinsella

text: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
author: Samuel Butler

text: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.
author: Sigmund Freud
